content.text: The balance sheet shows what a company owns (assets) and owes (liabilities) at a specific date. The difference is shareholder equity.
It reveals financial stability, debt levels, and asset strength. A company with heavy debt is more risky during business downturns.
Assets = Liabilities + Equity. This must always balance.
If assets are ₹500, and liabilities are ₹300, then equity is ₹200. This is the net worth of shareholders.
